<<<api>>>: BufferedReader.readLine
<<<code>>>: public RecordManager(){
    int pos;
    String athlete, record, country, raceTime;
    try {
        BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("resultdata.txt"));
        String line;
        while((line = br.readLine()) != null){
            String[] parts = line.split("#");
            athlete = parts[0];
            country = parts[1];
            pos = Integer.parseInt(parts[2]);
            record = parts[3];
            raceTime = parts[4];

            if("WRC".equals(record)){
                resultArr[size] = new WorldRecord(athlete, country, pos, raceTime);
            }
            else if("OLR".equals(record)){
                resultArr[size] = new OlympicRecord(athlete, country, pos, raceTime);
            }
            else{
                resultArr[size] = new RaceResult(athlete, country, pos, raceTime);
            }
            size++;
        }
        br.close();
    } catch (IOException ex) {
        Logger.getLogger(RecordManager.class.getName()).log(Level.SEVERE, null, ex);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem with your code is that you are using Scanner.next() which reads the input until the delimiter (which is space by default). In your case, you want to read the entire line and then split it into parts. This can be achieved by using BufferedReader.readLine() which reads an entire line. After reading the line, you can split it into parts using the split() method.
